data.title: Gender – Page 14 – Shelley Lowry Talent – Talent Agency Belfast, Dublin & London
data.text:
Antoin is a natural performer and has appeared in many television programmes and theatre productions to date.

He recently starred as the lead role in EWTN Productions Feature Film ‘Faith Of Our Fathers’ directed by Campbell Millar.

He has also appeared in:

2014, ‘Saol Faoi Shráid’ – Childrens television series – TG4

2016, Filmed for online storytelling

2019, Dead Still Episode 2 (Deadpan Pictures ) Role of twin boys Ivor/Samuel.

Maryann is a Belfast-based actor with approx. 10 years’ experience on stage, performing in theatres all across Northern Ireland throughout her career. Maryann trained in BA Drama at Queen’s University Belfast, before intensively studying acting in the Lyric Theatre Drama Studio. Maryann is constantly looking for new ways to further develop her craft.

Maryann also has experience on screen, starring in short films, music videos and television commercials. Maryann recently achieved roles in both a BBC (opposite Dylan Moran) and CBBC television productions only months apart from one another. She is currently one of the faces of PHA’s Organ Donation Campaign across Northern Ireland.

Additionally, Maryann is also the owner of her own theatre company.

PHA Organ Donation Campaign (2023 – Genesis Advertising dir. Darren Lyttle)

The Wife and Me… And My Sex Doll Ruby (2023 Sanctuary Theatre dir. Mark Kavanagh) “RUBY”

Nova Jones (2022 CBBC/Jam Media dir. Declan Recks) “SMOOTHIE NOVA”

Stuck (2022 – Episode 3 – BBC/Hattrick Productions dir. Ian Fitzgibbon) “YASMIN”

Lady Windermere’s Fan (2018 TOURING PRODUCTION dir. Stephen Beggs) “LADY WINDERMERE”

Linda appeared in Northern Ireland drama circles from 2007 in her late forties and has had the pleasure of working with many local theatre companies. Formerly a Management and Communications Consultant and a Race Relations Officer in Social Housing she has carried out work related live interviews on BBC and ITV and spoken at many conferences.

She began as an Extra with Extras NI appearing in many films and BBC productions. She trained under Rosie Pelan at the Crescent Arts Centre and progressed through drama classes and comedy improvisation. Linda has also attended several Lyric Workshops for actors including Accents and Dialects (RP and American), and Voice and Text with Michael Corbidge in 2017.

Linda has performed with DAMD, Studio Theatre Company (at the MAC and Brian Friel Theatre, QFT) and Bigger than Us Productions. She is a member of South Bank Playhouse and has appeared in several productions including the summer tour of Come Blow your Horn by Neil Simon (Belfast, Enniskillen and Newcastle).

Her largest theatre role to date was Madame Arcati in Noel Coward’s Blithe Spirit for 3 nights at the Brian Friel Theatre, QFT, Belfast.

Linda has appeared in several short films, adverts and her key featured television role to date is in an episode of Hope Street Series 3 as Bridget O’Carolan with Long Story TV (Hope Street) LTD.

Lewis McAskie is a talented young actor from Belfast.

Having developed a love for performing and acting from a young age participating in various productions at Belvoir Players Academy, he successfully auditioned for a number of film and tv roles as a teenager. He has performed in (and recently co-directed) a number of school productions and currently continues to study Drama at A-level.

Lewis’ most notable credits include:

2023 (post-production) – ‘Stranger with a Camera’ (‘The Sniper’s Daughter’) – Feature Film, Role: young Mossy, Dir: Oorlagh George, Prod: Fizzblister Films

2021 – ‘Belfast’ – Feature Film, Role: Will, Dir: Sir Kenneth Branagh, Prod: Lizziepop

2021 – ‘Ted’s Top Ten’ – CiTV series, one episode, Role: Large Librarian, Prod: Zodiac Kids

2021 – ‘Here Before’ – Feature Film, Role: Tadgh, Dir: Stacey Gregg, Prod: Here Before Ltd.

Thomas has been acting for over 25 years with extensive experience in stage, screen and radio productions.

His feature film work includes RIVERDANCE: THE ANIMATED ADVENTURE, SHERGAR, and CROSSMAHEART. Television includes FOUNDATION (Apple TV+), BLOODLANDS (BBC), ALMOST NEVER (BBC), CORONATION STREET (ITV), and EUREKA STREET (BBC).

Notable theatre performances include Fergal in WOMEN ON THE VERGE OF H.R.T. at Oldham Coliseum and Charlie Conlan in the UK number one tour of STONES IN HIS POCKETS.

He has also appeared in both THE CRUCIBLE and THE MERCHANT OF VENICE at the Lyric Theatre Belfast and played four characters in the acclaimed production of HAMLET at Lancaster Castle which was short-listed for the Peter Brook/Equity Ensemble Award.

Thomas has also performed in numerous radio plays for the BBC.

‘BLOODLANDS ’, (BBC), Role of Receptionist, Dir: Audrey Cooke

FOUNDATION ’, (Skydance Television/Apple TV+), Role of Customs Officer, Dir: Rupert Sanders

‘ALMOST NEVER’, (BBC), Role of Delivery Guy, Dir: Akaash Meeda

‘EUREKA STREET’, (BBC), Role of Brian, Dir: Adrian Shergold

‘CORONATION STREET’, ITV Productions – Role of Waiter, Dir: Terry Dyddgen-Jones and Charles Lauder

‘RIVERDANCE – THE ANIMATED ADVENTURE’, Feature film, Role of Townsfolk/Deer, Dir: Dave Rosenbaum & Eamonn Butler
